intro: Oenothera hirtella, commonly known as the hairy evening primrose, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Oenothera hirtella is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments and is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats.
